Title.evidence: This was a single-centre, double-blinded, parallel-group RCT

Trial_Design.evidence: This was a single-centre, double-blinded, parallel-group RCT investigating preoperative methylprednisolone 10 mg/kg (high dose) versus dexamethasone 8 mg (standard-dose postoperative nausea prophylaxis) in patients scheduled for open liver resection.

Participants.evidence: in patients scheduled for open liver resection

Intervention.evidence: investigating preoperative methylprednisolone 10 mg/kg (high dose) versus dexamethasone 8 mg (standard-dose postoperative nausea prophylaxis)

Objective.evidence: The aim of this study was to investigate whether a single high dose of preoperative glucocorticoid reduces complications in the immediate postoperative phase after liver surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was number of patients with a complication in the postanaesthesia care unit

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 174 patients (88 in high-dose group, 86 in standard-dose group) were randomized

Number_Analysed.evidence: 174 patients (88 in high-dose group, 86 in standard-dose group) were randomized and analysed

Result_Outcome.evidence: Complications occurred in the postanaesthesia care unit in 51 patients (58 per cent) in the high-dose group and 58 (67 per cent) in the standard-dose group (risk ratio 0.86, 95 per cent c.i. 0.68 to 1.08; P = 0.213).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Registration number: NCT03403517 ( http://www.clinicaltrials.gov ); EudraCT 2017–002652-81 ( https://eudract.ema.europa.eu/ ).
